concept.title: What is Profit Margin?
concept.definition: Profit margin is the percentage of gross profit relative to sales revenue, representing the difference between revenue and cost of goods sold.
concept.purpose: For every dollar of sales revenue, after deducting the cost of goods sold, how much money is available for period expenses and profit.

formula.margin: Profit Margin = {(Sales Revenue - Sales Cost) / Sales Revenue} √ó 100%
